ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other
Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Study; The code for each individual study
Notes: e.g., the name of the study in multi-grant collections

1=Toxicity or side effects related to study medication
2=Medical reason unrelated to study medication
3=Termination by principal investigator because of non medical reasons 4=Failed to return to clinic
5=Declined study participation
6 = Moved from area (current or pending)
7 = Death (Complete Serious Adverse Events Form)
8 = Subject no longer eligible to participate. 9 = School unable/no longer willing to participate
10 = Other

ElementDescription: Age 4 years 6 months to 14 years of age inclusive
Meet parent and teacher SNAP-IV criteria
Concurrent treatment with another psychotropic medication within one to three weeks of baseline
Exclusion criteria exception used for this subject ?
Date of case review in days from the Guanfacine enrollment date (ENR_D2 = Date of case review - Guanfacine enrollment date)
Presence of a chronic tic disorder
Entered MPH Arm but did not tolerate or had adverse reaction

Order of Enrollment - The first subject enrolled in the Guanfacine  Trial (i.e., the earliest enrollment date)  has ENRL_ORD = 1, the second subject enrolled has ENRL_ORD = 2, the third has ENRL_ORD = 3, etc.  Subjects enrolled on the same day are given the same number.
Days since MPH trial randomization (CROSSDAY = Guanfacine Enrollment Date - MPH Randomization Date)
Notes:
Derived variable, not on CRF
Only applicable to those subjects that participated in both the Randomized MPH Trial and the Guanfacine Trial.  Data are blank for all other subjects.
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Site PI signed off Eligibility Confirmation form

Notes: 1=Evaluation in progress; 2=Refused consent; 3=Ineligible/excluded; 4=Active stage 1; 5=Active stage 2; 6=Active HC control; 7=Completed HC control; 8=Stage 1 complete terminal; 9=Stage 2 complete; 10=Abnormal termination; 11=Withdrew consent; 12=In washout; 13=Dropped out/non compliant; 14=Project Completed; 15=Screened Only

ElementDescription: Create a safety plan with every participant at baseline appointment. Send it to them and save it on box. At post and follow-up visits review safety plan. For people without SI: remind them the plan is available, ask if they want to change anything on their plan, and make sure they have access to a copy. Was a safety plan created /reviewed for/with participant?
